titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Alan Le May Papers LSC.0880
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Phyllis Herzog, August 1965; machine-readable finding aid created by Alight Tsai.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-09-07 11:01:36 -0700.

did.abstract: Alan Le May (1899-1964) began his career as a journalist and author of westerns, some of which were adapted to the screen. He also produced a number of short stories and screenplays in addition to 17 novels. The collection contains manuscripts of novels, story outlines, and screenplays for television and motion pictures by Le May.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Alan Le May Papers (Collection 880). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Alan Le May was born June 3, 1899 in Indianapolis, Indiana; attended Stetson University and University of Chicago (Ph.B., 1922); began career as journalist; author of westerns, some of which were adapted to the screen, including The Searchers (1954) and The Unforgiven (1957); he was a prolific writer, producing a number of short stories and screenplays in addition to 17 novels; produced and directed High Lonesome in 1950; died on April 27, 1964.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection contains manuscripts of novels, story outlines, and screenplays for television and motion pictures by Le May. Also includes correspondence and ephemera.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Manuscripts (Boxes 1-21).
Research materials (Boxes 2, 22).
Personal papers (Box 23).

did.unittitle: African Pitfall. Original story treatment. Pacific Palisades.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Included are 5 copies, typescript and carbon. This is an outline of a story, with research information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This is a draft of a story, with plans and notes.

did.unittitle: Black Cat Patrol. Screenplay. California, ca.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Included are 4 mimeograph copies, in manila folders.

did.unittitle: The Blond in the Box Stall. n.p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Story frame.

did.unittitle: Boom Camp Printer. Story subject for The Virginian, a television series. n.p.
did.physdesc: Typescript and carbon. 4 copies with a few corrections.

did.unittitle: , vol.1 & 2. Research notes on the South and the Civil War.
did.physdesc: Typescript. Each volume bound in maroon paper cover, and filed in a manila folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: There is no indication as to when this work was done, but perhaps it was undertaken in conjunction with working on the Civil War Story, eventually titled By Dim and Flaring Lamps.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Story idea.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Story idea and plan for a series of screenplays.

did.physdesc: Typescript and carbons. 8 copies, with corrections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This is an outline and plan for a possible series of films.

did.unittitle: Hardship Post. Screenplay. Story outline, incomplete script. n.p.
did.physdesc: Typescript and carbon. Filed in manila folders.

did.unittitle: I'd Rather Be Dead Than Fourteen; and Other Stories. n.p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Included is an outline for a series of stories, and a ninety-minute story plan for I'd Rather Be Dead Than Fourteen.

did.unittitle: Brickyard. A one hour teleplay. n.p. Typescript, some carbon.
did.physdesc: Typescript, some carbon. Filed in manila folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Included are various versions, with extensive corrections, and note cards. The leaves are not in any particular order.

did.unittitle: By Dim and Flaring Lamps. [New York].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Included are many typescript leaves, notes, revised and corrected versions. The leaves are filed in manila folders, in no particular order. The novel is about the South and the Civil War.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Included are many typescript leaves, notes, and revised and corrected versions of a story that was later to become By Dim and Flaring Lamps. Research material is also included.
Many of the leaves are filed in manila folders, in no particular order. Other leaves are grouped in small boxes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Included is the story treatment of the screenplay, the screenplay itself, and correspondence and notes relating to the work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This appears to be another version of the Civil War Story that later became By Dim and Flaring Lamps.
Included are various notes, and typescript leaves of the novel.

did.unittitle: The Night Riders. n.p. (Later to become By Dim and Flaring Lamps.).

did.physdesc: Typescript, some carbon. Filed in manila folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This is a prospectus for a television series, and related drafts, and other materials. Many versions and revised leaves.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Some of the material is filed in a small box in Box 15 of the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Included is a story plan, and one 24-minute screenplay entitled An Old Man Coffee Story.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This is a screenplay, possibly for a series on television.
The leaves are filed in manila folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This apparently is a synopsis, and sequence rundown for a screenplay. Included are photos of actors and actresses clipped and pasted on sheets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: (Perhaps used in research for a series, or story)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This is a screenplay, 4 copies, 3 different versions, with corrections, and revisions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This is a screenplay, and includes character sketches, and outlines, rough draft.

did.physdesc: Typescript, mostly carbon, with extensive corrections. Filed in manila folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The notebooks consist of clipped pictures of various weapons, and commentary, pasted on sheets of paper (Probably used as research material).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Included are: I Was Hanged in Effigy, and 2 copies of Straight-Jacket for an Indian.
It appears that The Wide Country is the title of a television series.

did.unittitle: The Wide Country. Memory of a Filly. [California].
Wyoming. [California]. This appears to be story plans, or outlines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Television Schedules.

did.unittitle: Correspondence, ephemera, and personal papers (financial reports).
